title: TB starts on wrong monitor
content:
I use 128.7.1esr (64-bit) on Windows 11 23H2. OS Name Microsoft Windows 11 Home Version 10.0.22631 Build 22631 I use two monitors: Monitor 1 is physically straight in front of me, and Monitor 2 is to the left, so in Settings > System > Display the box on the right is numbered 1, and the box on the left is numbered 2.

Since the latest TB update, each time I switch on the PC in the morning, TB (and FF) open on Monitor 2, even though I closed them down on Monitor 1 the previous night. This behaviour used to happen occasionally, now it seems to happen every time. Also, occasionally during the day, the TB Reminders window will jump to Monitor 2 while it's minimised.

I suppose the first question is - is this a TB/FF problem or a Windows problem? I'm thinking it must be a TB/FF problem, because this behaviour only seems to be happening with them.

Any suggestions would be welcome.

title: Tb 128 - cannot see how to send email via Mailing List (allowing selection) as previously possible.
content:
I want to send an email to most (but not all) the members of a mailing list - as I used to be able to. In the historic (2015) Help article "How to create and use mailing lists on Thunderbird" the first of 2 methods of "Create email using a mailing list" was "Via the Address Book"; "each contact in the mailing list will appear in a separate To field. This allows you to remove a name, if desired. " To do this, the 3 steps were:- 1 Click Address Book to open it. 2 Select the mailing list. 3 Click the Write button. Using 128.7.1esr (64-bit), step 3 is not available; the 4 options after selecting the mailing list are

  • Edit list
  • Export
  • Print
  • Delete

Is there a way of actually doing what used to be possible before the improvements took place (and IIIBDFI was forgotten?)

title: Thunderbird in Windows 11
content:
Hi all.

I have just installed Thunderbird on my laptop, due to ongoing issues with using Outlook.

I have an MS Access database that I built using macros (I know, but it works perfectly fine for what I need!) I send emails with a signature and PDF attachments, or sometimes through a gateway (email to SMS), to inform guest about booking details at my small hotel.

Previously with Outlook, when I hit send on the database, it would pop the Outlook email window for me to review the mail before confirming send. Now I fin in Thunderbird, it doesn't display over the other apps, so I'm having to minimise or close the DB window, to review and send the mail.

I have already set Thunderbird as the default app in the setting menu, for all mail tasks and file types, and can't seem to find any other setting to allow it to display on top.

I was therefore wondering if anyone else has encountered a similar issue, and if they have, whether they were able to solve it before pulling out too much of their hair!

Any help would be much appreciated, thank you.

Mick Courcier

title: Archiving Thunderbird emails to "Other" Local Folder custom archive folder is ignored - archive still uses default Thunderbird Local Folders "Archive" folder
content:
I've set up email archiving for three IMAP accounts. Initially each account used its default Local Folders archive folder path (i.e. Account Settings > Copies & Folders > Message Archives), I had selected the first option, 'Keep message archives in "Archives" folder on Local Folders'. For the archive options, I selected to retain the original email account folder structure and to organize archived messages by year. This all worked fine but it resulted in a combined group of archived messages without any obvious separation of emails by IMAP account. I prefer to have emails archived and grouped according to email account just like they are organized in the main Thunderbird email account and folder hierarchy.

I then noticed the Account Settings archive messages option to select "Other" where I could point the archive to a custom-named folder on Local Folders. Hence, I created three new Local Folders, named "Archive-Gmail", "Archive-Outlook.com" and "Archive-Polarismail", and then selected each of these "Other" archive local folders in their respective IMAP account's Archive settings. However, when I archived a bunch of emails from one of the folders in my Polarismail account, the emails got archived back into the default Thunderbird Local Folders > Archives folder (which I had deleted, but it got recreated). That is, this new archive was stored under the folder tree "Local Folders/Archives/<foldername>/<year>".

Thinking that perhaps Thunderbird didn't like my use of the "-" for the archive folder name, I then tried renaming my Polarismail archive folder to "ArchivePolarismail" and then tried again to archive some emails from the Polarismail account. Again, the archive got placed in "Local Folders/Archives/<foldername>/<year>".

It seems that the "Other" option for creating a custom Local Folders archive folder and pointing the email account archive to it in the Settings doesn't work, at least not as I expect, in which case what function does this option serve? It appears that Thunderbird insists upon using/creating its archive folder with the "Archives" name, regardless of what parameters are set under the "Other" archive option.

I then briefly looked in the Thunderbird Config.editor settings and using the filter keyword "archive", found the following group of "archive" settings. There appear to be a bunch of old or redundant Archive folder location records since there are several entries for "mail.identity.id1.archive_folder" all of which are set to mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives.

I don't recall if/when I might have created and deleted archive locations within Account Settings, but the multiple entries (each with a different id#) containing the setting mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives suggests that this is the case.

I'm wondering if the order in which the mail.identity.id1.archive_folder entries are listed determines whether Thunderbird uses that particular entry or not and if Thunderbird is using the first few entries of the mail.identity.id1.archive_folder parameter to decide where to archive emails?

In any case, since I don't know what all this Config information does or affects, I'm afraid to haphazardly go about deleting any of the seemingly redundant entries - I would have expected Thunderbird to manage that from its Account Settings menu.

extensions.quickfilters.assistant.exclude.archive true mail.identity.default.archive_enabled true mail.identity.default.archive_granularity 1 mail.identity.default.archive_keep_folder_structure false mail.identity.default.archive_recreate_inbox false mail.identity.default.archives_folder_picker_mode 0 mail.identity.id1.archive_enabled true mail.identity.id1.archive_folder mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives mail.identity.id1.archives_folder_picker_mode 0 mail.identity.id10.archive_enabled true mail.identity.id10.archive_folder mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives mail.identity.id10.archive_granularity 1 mail.identity.id10.archive_keep_folder_structure false mail.identity.id10.archives_folder_picker_mode 0 mail.identity.id11.archive_enabled true mail.identity.id11.archive_folder mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives mail.identity.id11.archive_granularity 1 mail.identity.id11.archive_keep_folder_structure false mail.identity.id11.archives_folder_picker_mode 0 mail.identity.id12.archive_folder mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives-Gmail mail.identity.id12.archives_folder_picker_mode 1 mail.identity.id13.archive_enabled true mail.identity.id13.archive_folder mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives mail.identity.id8.archive_enabled true mail.identity.id8.archive_folder mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives mail.identity.id8.archive_granularity 1 mail.identity.id8.archive_keep_folder_structure false mail.identity.id8.archives_folder_picker_mode 0 mail.identity.id9.archive_enabled true mail.identity.id9.archive_folder mailbox://nobody@Local%20Folders/Archives mail.identity.id9.archive_granularity 1 mail.identity.id9.archive_keep_folder_structure false mail.identity.id9.archives_folder_picker_mode 0 mailnews.headers.showArchivedAt false mailnews.headers.showListArchive false mailnews.tags.archives.ordinal ~AUTOTAG mailnews.tags.archives.tag archives toolkit.telemetry.archive.enabled true


Ultimately, the questions are:

1) Is there a bug in the "Other" archive menu settings options?

2) Are there redundant/undeleted "archive" parameters in my Config settings, as shown above, and can or should they be manually deleted?

3) Is there a way to archive emails and separate them within the archive(s) according to their email account?


If anyone has any knowledge or ideas of what is or might be happening, please advise.

Dave

title: update password for comcast email using Thunderbird to deliver / receive my comcast emails.
content: Hello, I am Tom T, I have Thunderbird running version: 128.7.esr, and HP notebook PC with Windows 11, latest software. I need to enter updated password in it's permanent location in Thunderbird setup. When I search the internet, I can read that you must erase the existing password then manually enter the new password and apply it, but it is not available as the information indicated is not available on anywhere of my Thunderbird APP or on any of my Comcast email delivery screens. When I listen to instruction being spoken by Instructor on the internet, I can listen and see the instructor doing the steps. I use CC to better understand the instructor. I can see the instructor's screens that looks like what the Win11 Start Button brings up. When you press ALL on the upper right of my Start Screen, the screen is expanded, then you can search and find the Thunderbird entry. The instructor's screen also shows the APP to the right of Thunderbird, but my screen does not show that APP. If I click the Thunderbird icon, it brings up my Comcast Email application with email messages on the screen then pops up a small box that indicates: "Enter your password for your (my user name / email address)" in a box that has a check box to remember this password (so it can be viewed for the next time, I guess), if I enter the correct password, the email APP will go active and load my new emails. There is not any way I have been able to make the new password active on startup. Please help. This is the way it has been working since installed - for 5 years plus, until just recently I changed password twice and have same results. Thank you, your help is much appreciated. Please let me know if you would like any additional information. Best Regards, Tom T.

title: "Compact all folders when it will save over" not triggering right?
content:
Hello! I have used Thunderbird for many years. Lately, it waits much too long to prompt compacting all accounts. When "Compact all folders when it will save over ..." is set down to 1MB total, it still does not prompt until it has to clear 30 or 40 MB.

It didn't do this in the past, prompting me every 2 or 3 days at higher settings. So, I'm curious if this is "normal" now and I need to manually compact, or if there is a problem with 'Account Settings > Disk Space > Compact all folders' ... ?
creator: psig

title: Lost Folders
content:
I recently decided to close my email account and subsequently removed this email address from Thunderbird. As a result I realised I'd lost all my mail folders attached to this address, which are important to me.

I've had the account reinstated, but no longer have my mail folders. How can I find them?

Thanks Gabrielle Salt
creator: gabric

title: 2 sessions sur windows 11
content:
Bonjour, 

  Il y a deux utilisateurs sur ce PC sous Windows, donc deux sessions distinctes.

Sur une session Thunderbird fonctionne correctement, mais sur l'autre session, il est impossible d'envoyer un message apparait :

'''L’envoi du message a échoué. Une erreur est survenue lors de l’envoi de l’e-mail. Le serveur de courrier a répondu : <unknown[2a01:e0a:518:1e80:c99a:c769:d4bf:b858]:53867>: Client host rejected: Access denied. Veuillez vérifier l’adresse du destinataire jeanherve.costes@free.fr et essayer à nouveau. 

  Je venais de réinstaller Thunderbird et sur la deuxiéme session il est resté sur la version précedente.

Je ne sais pas comment faire, pouvez vous m'aider? D'avance merci. Cordialement
creator: jeanherve.costes

title: Duplicating Inbox folders in Thunderbird email list
content:
My Inbox Folder column is doing something weird. Duplicate sub-folders keep appearing. Some I can delete but then reappear. Other I can't delete at all. I see nothing in the help section that addresses this issue. Any helpful ideas? Attachment shows three of these annoying rebuilding folders.

Thank you Artstar
creator: artstar

title: Email
content: I can not get in to my email. I have changed my pass word twice ask you asked . this has been going on all day . what is going on
